reviews_by_person.text: Regardless of the fact that it is quite a distance from campus, it is very serene. Fully functional facilities: a conducive-for-learning study room, TV room, communal kitchen and many more perks.
Cool,and not known to have rowdy tenants. Never heard a complain from there before. Good hostel.
Very nice and serenely situated hostel with an open car pack space. Very accessible and close to the main road making transport to town easier.

Very nice hostel. Quite and serene. Quite far from Campus. About 30minutes walk. Closer to a main/busy road. Don't really know of the amount for staying but I believe it is a cheap one since it is quite far from school. The place has a WiFi connection, Cloud Ghana, which you need to pay for to access the internet. Proximity determines the price. The farther away from Knust campus , the cheaper & vice versa

It is very clean and safe for everybody
Conducive study room for studies
A Theater for watching football and other sports
And most importantly a very easy-to-find location

This hostel is such a lovely place! Great, welcoming and clean atmosphere! The staff is super friendly. The dorm rooms are really spacious. There is an artisan shop in the hostel's lobby that invites to buy hand-made clothes and accessory. I love the fact that the profit will go to the women empowerment project! Highly recommend staying at this hostel!

TUMI is such a lovely place! I would recommend it to everyone, because you will easily feel at home, meet friendly staff and travellers, enjoy delicious food and in the meantime support women and children! It is a cozy, welcoming, beautiful place!

Spend a night in this hostel and everything was perfect. Mixed dorm for 149 cedis per night (with breakfast included), very nice and quiet room with fan and a big bathroom and shower you share with the other people in the dorm. The staff is great, always helpful and attentive.
The decoration and atmosphere of the place are really nice. Everyone is laidback and chill, really nice people.
Every evening they organize a communal dinner for 60 cedis, I thought it was a bit expensive but it was really a lot of good food, plus you share it with other people at the table which is nice.
The only thing I could say was not top was the breakfast, which was not super healthy. I would include some fruit options or yogurt.

The dorm is very nice, spacious and cool, the bathroom even seems excessively large but that is not bothersome at all. Staff are friendly though they could provide slightly more information about how things like the breakfast works. Good price, really beautiful atmosphere, good location though the nearest trotro roads are a bit of a walk if you don't want to take a taxi, uber or tuktuk/pragya. They have wondwerful initiatives of women empowerment and plastic separation, sell locally produced items and are very lenient about arrival times and stay extentions.

Superb guest house and enterprise with excellent gift store selling beautiful goods handmade in the premises by the seamstress academy on site. Staying in the dormitory which is like my old boarding schoolüòÑ staff are lovely, very accommodating and helpful. Food is on pointü´∂üèæ

This hostel does not deserve even a star.
1. The staff lack manners.
2. Daily water issues.
3. They do not understand simple landlord and tenant relationships.
4. They treat tenants as though they live in the rooms for free.
5. They Enter rooms freely when tenants are not around without informing them.

This is my experience.

They have rooms that are spacious enough and the environment is good
It's a place that is well kept and the management is good
They also have a basketball court and a big parking space with good security
Only downside is the distance from campus
I like how the rooms are spacious and the siren environment there even though students do make noise but it cool over there. Aside that it's a good place to be.
Honestly this hostel has everything you'll need, the only disturbing issue is it's distance from campus but apart from that it's undoubtedly the best hostel in kumasi. Oh and it's very affordable
The environment is absolutely Serene but the road leading up to the hostel seems to be the major pitfall.

reviews_by_person.text: They appear good inside but I think they need to work more on the outer space
It is a Hostel alright. Nice rooms and all. But how to get food is tiring.
Great place for student accommodation. Restaurants, television rooms, grocery shops, gift ships available. Mobile money transactions available

Spacious rooms
Only forms of transport are shuttle and taxis, no troskis. But the shuttle is free so it's okay
Their porters( front desk) seem nice
Pretty comfortable. Only downside is that it is pretty far from the rest of the campus. Security is quite good and transports vehicles are always present to help you to your destination

Great and nice hostel with all the facilities. There's a power plant that kicks in when the power is out. Water is always flowing. There's constant gas supply and a cloud you can access Internet services on. Great place to lodge in for an academic year
A good place and very close to the university campus

It's ok. Location is very very very on point. Infact for Bomso area it is the closest to campus. But the prices are seriously high and the facilities aren't worth the price if you ask me. Please reduce the price a bit or renovate the facility to match the bid.
A very cool place to live. I recommend that hostel for everyone.

Very comfortable and convenient as well.
Has good services and security.
Will recommend for all.
A very nice hostel for students. It is also very close to campus and the environment is mostly busy so you won't be scared walking in the evening. The hostel environment itself is serene.
Victory Towers is one of the nicest hostel around KNUST
A beautiful hostel where you feel at home.

The only reason I gave this four stars is because of how expensive it is to live here. This place is neat, spacious and relatively closer to KNUST campus so if you‚Äôre looking for comfort and convenience, this is how you but the price is not for everyone
One of the best hostels off campus in knust. Prices are expensive but worth it. Rooms are nice and cool, has good security and water flows 24/7. Highly recommended üëå

reviews_by_person.text: Outrageous prices, ontop of it you have to pay for 'Protocol'. It's kinda worth it compared to the insecurity off campus though. If you can afford it why not

It's ok
The problem here is, if you successfully book a room or retain(or change room), you will have to make payment weeks or even  months before you start using the facility.

Portal opens residents to maintain or change rooms during the month of the second semester.

And for non residents, the end of the semester or vacation. (Very competitive).

In any case, payments should be made within a given time period. Failure to pay on time forfeit your reservation.

2 in a room available, 3 in a room available, and 4 in a room available. Room is decorated by occupants. Quite spacious room. Very rarely water is a problem. But it's the best place to stay on KNUST campus.
They have nice accommodation for students. It's standard is international and most of the foreign students live in these hostels and a well equipped sports complex.
There's privacy, neat and beautiful scenery. Clean environment, WiFi for study purposes and spacious rooms.

Prestige Hostel is a suitable hostel which will give every student the perfect environment to study in tranquility while providing the needed comfort. If you are a serious student and you have the money, then this is the hostel for as the hostel fee is quite expensive according to the average Ghanaian economic standard

Great... It was a moment when the Chief of Anyanso, Nana Yaw Kckc Ampaben II and the entire community including the younger ones decided to do a clean up exercise and to commission a newly built community impact project made by the collaboration of Anyansoman Mpuntuo Kuo and Anyanso Unit Committee... You can see the chief busily working...
Not bad at all
Very Nice Rooms & Environment
Having a quite environment at all the time.

Hydes Hostel is a nice place to be. The security is very tight and it has quite a big compound. It has two entrances: small way for humans and big gateway for vehicles. No Dusty compound and I love that it has a pharmacy shop just in front of the hostel.
I stayed here as a student and i never had any problems. The management takes very good care of the place and complaints are quickly addressed. Very hospitable reception. Home away from home indeed.
A very cool place to hold secret meeting and enjoy leisure time. The car park has no canopy
Prices for rooms are very friendly.  Place is always kept very neat. Also has a huge study room for students' advantage
Comfortable ü§ù
Stand by plant get turned on only at nights.  water flows everyday but get can cut like 6 times In a day( at least when I was there). But other wise the place is cool. Solid 4

Beautifully designed with a very spacious parking space. Flint Hostel is an ideal dwelling place of a student. It's close to campus thus making it easy to access the facilties on campus at almost any time. Consider this place when looking for a hostel for a friend or family member.

Flint is a nice hostel. They have good facilities. Their maintenance team is also responsive. I would have given them a five star but their price increment is not linear; it's kind of expensive for me.

Personally, I have stayed there for two years and will be there for another year. One of the best yet affordable hostels known to Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology. Rapid repairing of damaged room items, Proper waste disposal, constant cleaning by exceptional cleaner, hard-working manager and amazing people to meet are a few of the many things Flint Hostel boasts of. Flint Hostel, "A home away from home".

One of the best hostels I have been to.
Best organized and tidy.
Friendly and welcoming environments
But road leading to the hostel is not in good shape
Good quiet place. Relatively far (20mins walk) from the Campus

Better compartment I have ever seen around knust off-campus. The place is cool and very spacious, a big compound with good security. The most inspiring thing is that each room is having front and back yard.

Nice hostel facility and in close proximity to KNUST campus. Well fenced with a security post with a security personnel on site 24/7 ensuring maximum protection for students. Nice car park too available
A good hostel for students
Well I think it's a nice place but too far from campus. Publishing, textiles and other arts students might find it close but most faculties are farther away from the location of the hostel.
Place is conducive for students . Have their own basketball court with a restaurant

Providence has provided...bad pun? Yeah I thought so. Still doesn't take away from how good this place is. Aesthetically, it's an eye candy but that's not all it is. There's a conference room, comfortable lobby and general kitchen that's always treating my nose to some flavorful aromas. Very quiet place as well for those who want a more  serene environment and did I mention they had a basketball court?
This hostel has a lot greens(decorative plants), basketball court, spacious rooms, secure compound, store inside the building. It's a thumbs up for me

Serene Environment, good service...restaurant at basement, laundry (not free), shuttle, stand by generator and solar panel (doesn't cover rooms as at today) available, spacious rooms, good study environment, and modern. Expensive (GHS 2, 700 for 4-in-a-room, in 2021-2022), but not too much for its standards. Its okay.
Providence Hostel is a very beautiful place with nice lawns and a basketball court. It's one of the best places to consider if you are looking for a hostel.

Nice Hostel. After paying the Hostel fees you get all time access Gas, DSTV (all you need is to get a TV and you' good to go), Water( but they have slight challenges sometimes with the top floors).

You pay for the lights though (Prepaid meters). Rooms are spacious enough but the washrooms need a little more space.

Security around is great üëç...so yeah.

It was called Evandy Hostel but now changed to Ultimate Hostel,is one of the finest Hostels around campus located at bomso.It has full security services 24/7,there's a police station just there and close to the students bus stop at bomso gate,students wait and join the schools shuttle to their various colleges and faculties

Also known as Ultimate hostel.
Rooms here are affordable, and the rooms are quite spacious. Although I've seen most rooms with wardrobes and a few other fancy things, I must say some rooms(like mine) do not have a wardrobe and a clothe hangar. Some rooms have broken sinks which you can make a report to the hostel admin. They, however, won't fix it instantly as it takes some time due to the many people who keep reporting. The kitchens in this hostel are not in the rooms, but rather, there are about 2 big kitchens on each floor with gas stoves and a sink. Electricity is paid for, but water supply is free. Sometimes, there are water shortages, and it can go on for a whole day
I often experience power cuts when the rain is about to fall. Yeahhh, that's it for now.
I may update this later :))
Hope this helped üëå

Even though it's a bit far from campus, it is one of the best hostels you can get at an affordable price off campus. Look no further if you want to get away from the hustle and tusle of being on campus or if you are looking for a serene yet beautiful environment to live in.

Fortune Royal stands as a beacon of comfort and convenience in the bustling student community of Ayeduasi new site, just a leisurely 20-minute stroll from the KNUST engineering gate. This hostel, renowned for its picturesque ambiance and comprehensive amenities, offers residents an unparalleled living experience.

Nestled amidst lush greenery, Fortune Royal boasts a serene environment conducive to both relaxation and productivity. Each aspect of the hostel's design has been meticulously crafted to cater to the diverse needs of its inhabitants. From its tastefully decorated common areas to its thoughtfully appointed study spaces, every corner exudes an air of sophistication and tranquility.

One of the hallmarks of Fortune Royal is its commitment to providing residents with state-of-the-art facilities. Every floor is equipped with a dedicated TV room, allowing students to unwind with their favorite shows or bond over movie nights with friends. For those seeking a quiet space to focus on their academic pursuits, the hostel offers a spacious study area located in the basement, providing the perfect environment for concentration and productivity.

In today's fast-paced world, staying connected is essential, and Fortune Royal ensures that residents are always well-connected with complimentary high-speed WiFi access available throughout the premises. Whether it's completing assignments, staying in touch with loved ones, or streaming content online, students can rely on the hostel's reliable internet service to meet their digital needs.

While the price of accommodation at Fortune Royal may be considered higher compared to other options in the area, it is undoubtedly reflective of the exceptional value and amenities provided. For students who prioritize comfort, convenience, and a superior living experience, the investment is well justified.

In conclusion, Fortune Royal stands as a testament to excellence in student accommodation, offering a harmonious blend of comfort, convenience, and luxury. With its idyllic location, modern amenities, and unwavering commitment to resident satisfaction, it sets the standard for hostel living in Ayeduasi new site.
The best so far with various benefits. 24hrs internet services and great serene Home for refreshing and comfort
It‚Äôs a cool place
It's a nice place to stay
Great

Splendor Hostel emerges as a premier accommodation facility strategically situated in close proximity to the main gate of the campus, making it an ideal residence for students enrolled in the College of Agriculture, the Faculty of Built Environment, and the College of Engineering. This well-appointed hostel not only prioritizes convenience but also ensures a wholesome living experience for its residents.

Boasting an expansive compound, Splendor Hostel provides ample parking space, addressing the practical needs of students who commute with their vehicles. The hostel goes beyond mere accommodation, aiming to create a vibrant community atmosphere by offering various amenities within its premises.

Within the confines of Splendor Hostel, residents have access to a diverse range of facilities. A dedicated food joint and restaurants cater to culinary preferences, providing students with convenient dining options right at their doorstep. Additionally, the inclusion of a salon within the premises ensures that residents can easily access grooming services.

For those inclined towards retail therapy, Splendor Hostel goes the extra mile with its on-site shopping mall. This feature not only adds a touch of convenience but also creates a lively environment where residents can fulfill their shopping needs without venturing far.

Recognizing the importance of holistic well-being, the hostel also features a gym center for exercise enthusiasts. This facility allows students to maintain an active lifestyle conveniently, contributing to both physical fitness and overall mental well-being.

In essence, Splendor Hostel isn't just a place to reside; it's a multifaceted community hub designed to enhance the college experience for students, offering a harmonious blend of comfort, convenience, and recreational opportunities.
Rooms are spacious.  The hostel has a dstv and a dried up pool
The rooms are very spacious and worth the price with constant water and light supply. Not forgetting tight security

Nice hostel, nice staff and people. The rooms are quite spacious though. But has  serious water issues. It has a solar system which helps with light when theres light out. It takes long for any damages you came to meet in the room be fixed. I don't know how that's possible but there are too many mosquitoes in the rooms. It‚Äôs a nice place with serene environment and lovable atmosphere. It has hostel accommodations, chop bars, restaurants, pickup joints. It has more than five hostel buildings and a police station. It‚Äôs closer to Trinity oil (Kentenkrono) which makes it easier for students to fill their cylinders with gas when the need arise. There is a guesthouse/ hotel with a large park, restaurant and also a flower garden just behind Trinity oil.
I stayed here as a student when it was built. The environment has improved greatly since then, with lush green grasses and shady trees where you can take romantic walks.
The area is really serene. The rooms are spacious and well designed, making the place very comfortable to live in. The distance is a minor barrier, especially if you enjoy being away from crowds.

The area is so quiet and serene. There are trees all around with sizable parking and good roads.  It is quite a distance from the main campus area,  but the availability of free campus shuttles eases the stress of having to find transport although transport to campus is inexpensive. Due to its relative isolation,  the place records several robberies from "akwashey fuo" (thieves). Great care must be taken when commuting at night,  and walking in groups is advised.

reviews_by_person.text: It's a noisy place during the weekend and a very quiet and peaceful place during the weekdays. It's a cool place to relax and unwind after a long day. The view from the balconies is not that bad either.

The Brunei Complex at Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology (KNUST) in Kumasi, Ghana, is a modern facility designed for academic and administrative purposes. It houses lecture halls, offices, laboratories, and other facilities essential for teaching, research, and administrative functions within the university. The complex is named after Brunei, a sovereign state located on the island of Borneo in Southeast Asia, symbolizing international partnerships and collaborations in education and development.
I love the place because it has nice rooms,nice girls , rich living in there and also nice entrance and car park.

formatted_address: Behind, Aprade Junction, Engen Service Station, Accra Rd, Kumasi, Ghana

reviews_by_person.text:
I only went there to swim and it was fun. I'd advise anyone who wants to swim to do so during weekdays if possible. That way you can enjoy the pool with only a few people around.
I bought their fried rice and it taste fine.

Location is perfect, just a stone throw away off the Kumasi-Ejisu highway.
A great location for swimmers and Pool lovers, as they have a sizeable pool of about 25meters long.
For anyone who wants to learn swimming,  it's a good location as they have a pro swimming coach who doubles as a national swimming coach(Mr.Ansah)

Their pool is sufficiently big but they didn't have towels readily available for when you're done swimming. You have to come with yours. They have nice dishes, drinks and snacks available but orders take quite some time. Cost 15ghc to swim.

Excellent service Manager Evans is world class. Will definitely recommend it to anyone looking for affordable yet comfortable accommodation in and around Kumasi.

P.S still trying to get over the size of that pool üòÉ
They currently run a student hostel & swimming services.

address_components.long_name: Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology

reviews_by_person.text:
This hostel is overpriced and not worth the expenditure. Just go to Brunei.
It's only advantage are the provision shops in there and the daily cleaning. 2 Washrooms are shared with 8 other people.

Tek Credit is a nice, quiet hostel close to Baby Brunei. As far as I know, there is a 3 in a room option and a 2 in a room option.

It's a relatively quiet place with a hair salon, a few restaurants such as Calabash and a provisions store. So, you don't have to walk far for food or anything else you need. The hostel itself is clean and neat with the rooms being somewhat spacious. They could be a little bit larger but they're not terrible. It's also pretty safe as security is tight, especially at night when its very necessary these days

In the mornings, it can be difficult to get running water at times, making it difficult to prepare for the day. This hostel is also incredibly difficult if not impossible to get for some which I think is unfortunate. It's pretty much been corrupted to the point that the only way in is through protocol.

I've stayed at Tek Credit hostel for a year and this is my honest review.

1. Getting into Tek Credit Hostel
You'd have heard the stories that you need protocol among other things to be able to come here, well the truth is- it is true.
To be sure your application is successful, I'll recommend you come here with a lecturer or get someone inside to help you get in. it might be sad but that's just how it is. The previous notwithstanding, write an application letter and submit it at the Tek Credit office near the RC church ( it's in between old laundry, The RC church and the fuel station on KNUST Campus). I got in directly this way and you can too. The earlier you apply the better.

2. Experience:
-Rooms: Tek Credit Hostel won't be your ideal haven in case you're into big spaces and want maximum comfortability. From my perspective it was built with undergraduate students in mind. It is however excellent though. They offer 3 in 1 room mostly, however, with lots of money comes lots of
comfort, you can get a 2 in 1 at a higher price.

Everyone lives in a flat. Every floor has four flats. Two female flats and Two male flats.
Every flat contains 3 rooms.
Every flat has two washrooms and a very spacious kitchen. (don't worry, it's really big you will probably (most likely)  like it).

-Fees
The prices, I cannot disclose,  Just visit the hostel and you'd get to know the price. However, contrary to popular belief, Tek Credit is not the most expensive Hostel on campus ( sure its a hot cake, no doubt, and the only private Undergraduates hostel on campus) but in my one year stay, the GUSS hostels( i.e Brunei etc) had their prices marginally higher.

- Services
Tek Credit surpasses every hostel on campus in this aspect. It has washroom cleaning services ( not room cleaning services, ain't no one here yo mama :) . Despite a few off says that the cleaners might give you a hard time for keeping the places dirty,  it's all good most of the time. (don't make too much noise too, they'll notice you :) )

There is a provisions store on the second floor- they sell bread, biscuits, water, drinks etc. Although a bit pricey, it's a better offer than not having any and also how they're save you from walking a distance.

There is a printing press on the first floor, (the man there sells thrift clothes, perfumes etc, a barbering and women's saloon on the second floor ( was not fully operational in my first year's stay).

Laundry
There's no laundry but you can get one of the caretakers to do your washing at a fee.
Just ask the security people on the ground floor. They can also sow your torn clothes too.

Entertainment
Tek credit has a TV in every flat. Just get a VGA cord and play your movies, games etc on the main tv. You can bring your PlayStation and Xbox too. (please change the battery in your TVs remote don't be like my flat boys).

Security:
To rate security at Tek Credit I'd say this,
When you close from class and you're passing by, the porter will simply tell you, your key is not here. They know everyone that comes and goes. They have a keen eye on everything.
No one has complained about theft but just make sure your stuff are secured.

You don't pay water bills or buy electricity yourself.  Unlimited and very strong campus WIFI and you can also easily access Shuttles at the Brunei Shuttle station. The water supply is also very efficient.

There are two big study rooms on the 4th floor.
Every room has two tables and chairs inside too. Also there are like four long wardrobes in every room.

It's not all rosy at Tek Credit Hostel though, repair work sometimes takes forever and also if you go out and return after 1 am, you'd most likely meet a locked hostel, you'd have to shout for sometime to make the night porter open it for you. The DSTV bills aren't paid for like a whole semester at times too.
Also in light of yearly increasing fees there should be more renovation works.

There's no perfect hostel but Tek Credit Hostel is honestly top notch, that's why I'd gladly give it 4 stars.

Great place. I don't like flats and the idea of sharing a bathhouse but others don't mind and it's my opinion anyways.
Every flat has a TV and a fridge. So I sa it is comfortable.

Cool and homely
Rooms are in flats with each flat having its own, Television, refrigerator and off course, a Kitchen and a balcony!!
These flats are usually serviced by a domestic staff
Very Nice Environment...All Bathrooms Has Heaters...Some Rooms already has Air-conditioning and it Comes with its price
The best

Cool
As the name goes "The best" it's truly the best
It's a nice place to be. In fact, the most interesting thing is that every room has a television set, so you can Clare your eyes when you are boredüòÉüòÉüòâ

Home sweet home üè°

It's a good hostel with accommodating porters and a serene environment on most days. It is also closer to campus with a lot of lights in it's environs which makes it difficult for robbers. I'd recommend this for every student in KNUST

Carefully laid out plan with space to hold social meetings, a t.v room and an open court for sports. Access to water reservoirs, convenience stores and closer to a main street which leads to major towns in kumasi. Closer to the university campus and a very cool location conducive for learning and rest

Went for a meeting of alumni in their learning area. Its cool for its purpose. The place is for students. They have everything one can think of for students. Salon, learning space, TV space, generator, games/parking area.
Westend as a hostel 4/5 starts is quiet okay, large rooms good water supply and easy access to main campus due to its closeness but jxt a bit of mobile network issues
Overall, I would rate it as average. Not extraordinary. The interior spaces needs some maintenance and upgrade.

formatted_address: Boadi , behind Mount Oliver prayer camp 5 minutes drive from KNUST 4 minutes drive from Shell Filling Station,Boadi junction, AK-772-1557 (Digital Address, Kumasi, Ghana

reviews_by_person.text:
Talking about the location
The hostel is located at a very conducive and the environment, serene.
Their rooms are very spacious and neatly cared for. Well decorated rooms with colourful environment. Less noise because the hostel is located at the new site of Buadi which arguably there are virtually no noise going on in the areas
Talking about their services.
At Buadi Executive Hostel, their services there are top-notch, infact, one in a million. From the receptionist to the other workers, infact they are good indeed. Your number one place for your holidays and birthday parties and also your wedding ceremony.

They claim it‚Äôs 5 min from campus meanwhile it‚Äôs about 20 minutes drive from campus,No shuttle services,Water doesn‚Äôt flow 24/7 in fact it barely flows.There r better hostels around the area in the same price range

Not nice. Hot water isn't available on some ground floor rooms. Facilities, especially toilets are neglected. Refrigerators stink. Bedspreads are dirty, even with sand in them.   Took a long time to switch on generator for alternative power. Don't be deceived by images.

Oh lord. We did not have a good experience here. The outside looks nice but the inside needs work. The workmanship is not good in the rooms. Barely any sockets, the TV didnt work well. Things were broken. The bathroom was not clean because there was a staff member cleaning it when we got in the room. The fridges in the rooms were filthy. They didnt have enough drinks and ice available. One of our party members went into the kitchen and said it was dirty also. The sheets in the room were stained also. I would not recommend this place to anyone wanting to stay in the area.
It's a great place, large rooms with comfortable living spaces for very affordable prices. They don't have WiFi though. And there's no pool too. The road to the place is a bit sketchy too.

It's one of the most beautiful hostels off Knust campus. What makes it even much better is that it's not too far from campus. It's about a 15-20 minutes walking distance from the engineering gate.

The place is cool and conducive for students

The place is very nice and enjoyable.

Orange Hostel is a classic residence to stay for your KNUST life (a serene environment).
It has spacious rooms and comfortable beds (per room occupancy), room-specific washroom (plus washing area) and balconies.
It has a study room, a gymnasium and most especially a mini-shuttle (bus) for transporting residents to campus (20-30 minutes walking distance).

It has a serene, cool and secured atmosphere. The place has a gymn, back up generator, and the police barracks is about 200m behind the hostel. It is about 2-3 kilometers away from KNUST main campus. About 2 kilometers from high school junction.

On a scale of 1-10

Security Check always, just slightly better than the Halls. Accommodation for continuing students only.
There are no standby generators and do have intermittent water issues
Rooms are relatively small to contain four individuals at a time. The surrounding area untarred making the place muddy and untidy whenever it rains.

It was a nice place. A place for students for knust
Before you enter the main entrance of the hostel, you will be verified before going in
Spacious rooms and a nice environment. The security personnel are doing a good job as well
What a structure. Very spacious serine environmentü§©.
Not bad , it's good but some of the rooms have to share the same washrooms and kitchen
Compared to other hostels it has a long way to go before it matches up. But might be more affordable by the way
It‚Äôs close to campus
It's nice
Too poor

Pretty cool
One of the best hostels around new site
Main gates are closed at 10pm. Regardless of your situation the gates won‚Äôt be opened for you after 10pm. This is the only hostel in knust campus which has this ridiculous rule.
It's a very nice experience. The rooms are spacious and nice

Rooms are big enough and well spaced.
Well ordered and numbering system for easy identification
Rooms are very spacious but it is located a bit far from KNUST campus
Adombi Heights, that's their new block is quite worth the cost. The ground floor balconies need to be covered though because of dust and rain. And it's too exposed. Aside that everything is good.

Adom bi is a fairly good hostel, with decent rooms and bed sizes. However, the prices may or may not be considered too expensive. Point is, there are cheaper hostels around here. You decide based on your finances.
Nonetheless, the beds are spacious, great washrooms and spacious rooms too.

It's a nice hostel and the rooms although not very spacious can serve it's purpose.
A lot of commercial buildings are also found close to the hostel making it a very good place to stay for a reasonable amount of time.
The new building is well equipped and facilities are very modern. The rooms are spacious yet a little on the pricey side. They provide good services and the hostel is very close to campus.

Really expensive and overated like Frontline. But the Heights look pretty cool. I don't know how the room look like but it's new so definitely modern. The old block.... Errmmmmm, just a regular overpriced accommodation
It's a cool hostel to be in. Located at fnf, it is not that far from campus, you can walk or take a bus to make it faster. Suitable for a quiet life
It's a nice place and on the quiet side of New Site. Rooms are relatively bigger than a couple of hostels around. Price is on the low too.
It's a nice place though the place is boring. The unisex salon in front of it has a very good service. I love the hair I had done there.
Nice and spacious hostel located at Ayeduase close to Rakco. The hostel manager should keep the place clean and maintain the place well
The building is a bit old but it is still a nice place to relax for a while and a popular hostel as well.
Rooms are nice but the compound is not the best.
Home Away From Home its a nice and fabulous hostel inside KNUST - Ayeduase with good and ultra modern facilities and security as well.
comfortable hostel but missing simple necessities such as a wardrobe
Sure is a nice place to be ,with all the good conditions you could get
Comfortable accommodation for visitors. It has open space for outdoor

name: Crystal Hostel
adr_address: M9RR+7P4, O. A. St, Kumasi, Ghana
formatted_address: M9RR+7P4, O. A. St, Kumasi, Ghana

reviews_by_person.text: Hostel for students of Kumasi Technical University. Good room layout, everything looks nice at the new block, usually water does not flow 24/7. But it flows very well in the morning and Evening. The hostel is very close to the campus and the security system here is not the best but it‚Äôs good.
It has a conducive environment for living and studying for students. There's a game room to have fun, free WiFi and lot of stuff
Busy Street
Is a very nice hostel
Very nice
Such a cool place with strong wifi connection. Friendly porters and a peaceful environment just that it is a little far from the faculty areas
Great hostel, huge parking and awesome security for students. Rooms are a tad smaller but okay for students

An awesome hostel for your ward.
Kinda a 5 star hostel
School WiFi available
Shuttle available
Nice rooms and good and strong security
Good and very quiet place
The hostel is actually a peaceful one and the rooms are spacious to accommodate the required number of students allotted. Now painted in a new ash color both the hostel and premium.

Well there's quite a number of Canam hostels but I have been to Canam Premium. It's got quite a nice layout and the rooms are spacious with a balcony and all. I usually hear of frequent water shortages though.
Found in Ayeduase. Nothing overwhelming

Hostel is good.  Security is satisfactory (70%) which is above average. Accommodation ongoing. One problem is most of the rooms have problems that has lasted for almost years. Beware of room C-14,  it has a whole lot of problems. Issues reported too are overlooked.

It's a nice place but has a lot of work to be done about spacing in rooms, the other facilities that would make living comfortable.

They hardly attend to problems reported
The map direction was good but it looks like your left is right on the map
I have been here for the past four years and I can say that relatively their services are good.
It's a cool place

This is such a lovely place with big rooms, and a friendly and easily accessible porter. The place is close to and a walking distance away from most faculties. It has all the basic amenities plus a kitchen, TV room, and study room. Students are very friendly here and easily get along. There is fast resolution of room problems, most of all, the price is just right.
The place looks decent, the surrounding is a bit compact and the staircase is very steep. There are no elevators so one has to be very meticulous using the stairway.

Yvonna Hostel is a residential facility for students who live off campus. This hostel is located at Ayeduase adjacent Nyame Mireku Plaza and directly opposite the Resurrection Power and Living Bread Ministries International Church premises. Self- contained rooms and cozy apartments are available for University students.
For a hostel is great, it's roomy and serene but  with no study
It's a really small hostel.. not very popular
I believe the room will be too small for a lady
Too small
Oh the place is cool and spacious. They have a free gym center, dstv and snooker
Very nice hostel,not all that far from campus with nice facility with dstv
It has a nice, beautiful and serene environment. Spacious rooms and really affordable. In short its a perfect hostel.
The place is cool and it's located at Kotei opposite the police station. About 5 mins walk from the roadside to the hostel.

name: Franco Hostel
adr_address: MC8Q+X5X, Franco Hostel Rd, Kumasi, Ghana
formatted_address: MC8Q+X5X, Franco Hostel Rd, Kumasi, Ghana

reviews_by_person.text: Hmmm locking the room at 12 will disturb we the architure student üò≠üò≠üò≠üò≠

It's quite comfortable, contains a kitchen, a quite spacious washroom, and has supermarkets and food stalls surrounding it, so you wouldn't have to worry about walking long distances to buy food and snacks. It houses a maximum of 4 persons in a room and has a plant that cuts in when there's power outage. There's laundry service very close to it so your laundry is covered when you feel lazy doing them.
It's not your 5 starred hotel that has almost all services and facilities but it's comfortable, at least for me.üôÇ

One of the best hostels in that area. They have a backup generator for when power cuts. Spacious rooms. Study rooms. Parking space for students with cars. 4 in 1, 3 in 1 and 2 in one available here. There are food spots around the hostel. And a TV room.

Although I can't really tell the current state of Franco yet I know Franco hostel is a very nice place with very good facilities. It's accommodation ranges from one in a room down to four in a room. The fees are very affordable and therefore I strongly recommend Franco to anyone who may want to get a better accommodation.
They have a well-stocked mini shop that sells groceries. They also have a TV room. The place is fun to be
Nice hostel and close to campus too
It's a relatively decent place for a uni student
My only problem is water issues
It picked the shortest route, so I got to my destination fast.
It's a nice place when viewed from afar. But the A block has very frequent water shortages. The plant is also not available as a backup when there is power outage.

name: Getfund Hostel
adr_address: Clinical Students' Hostel, KATH, Kumasi, Ghana
formatted_address: Clinical Students' Hostel, KATH, Kumasi, Ghana

reviews_by_person.text: Great memories of my stay there ascd
Clinical Students' Hostel. Has a gym, a salon and a spacious car park.
It‚Äôs not open to the public. It is for clinical students. The rooms are averagely small but they tend to manage. Shared bathrooms are kept clean most of the time.

It has an ICT lab, a library, two large class rooms, TV room, a gym center, a chapel and a shop.
Security over there is also good.

4in1 rooms: each has a balcony
Two rooms share a toilet and bathroom.
It has a comfortable milieu for studying, having interactive sessions with peers. Overall, the place is kept tidy and functional for local operations to be carried out smoothly.

name: Valco Hostel

reviews_by_person.text: It's all male hostel and very conducive for studying,there's a canteen, tv room,study room,mini super market and a tennis table to release tension when you are tired learning
Male Hostel for clinical year medical students has a nice common room and a tuck shop.
It's the premier hostel among the Clinical students' hostels - KATH and all the fun do happen here.
The place is okay
the place is lovely and cool sweet to be
